results.title: A Class Divided
results.creator_credit: William Peters and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description: Jane Elliott divided her classroom into blue-eyed and brown-eyed children to teach them the degrading effects of discrimination. “A Class Divided” shows the result of her teaching on the adults who took her class as children in the 1960’s. Her teaching method was so successful that it has been used as a basis for training workshops on racism within the US prison system, and is used by business companies to expose racist attitudes amongst employees and employers. Elliott herself says that the “necessity for this exercise is a crime. But I think this exercise ought to be taught by every teacher.”

results.title: A City is
results.creator_credit: James Carney, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: More than buildings, more than people, a city is a total expression of purpose and aspiration, past and present. This is a multi-image look at the conglomerate city, composed of a whole stream of visual and auditory impressions presented without commentary. Often the screen subdivides - two, three, a dozen images appear at the same time, creating a counterpoint of the turbulence and discord, the harmony and sophistication of the big city.

results.title: A Christmas Special with Luciano Pavarotti
results.brief_description: A glorious concert performed at the spectacular Notre Dame Cathedral, Montreal, Luciano Pavarotti’s Christmas present to music lovers everywhere. Features “Christmas Medley”, “O Holy Night”, “Pieta Signore”, “Gloria”, “Silent Night”, “Ave Maria”, “Mille Cherubini in Coro”, “Agnus Dei”, “Gesu Bambino”, “Panis Angelicus”, “Oh Come All Ye Faithful”, “O Jesu Christii”, and “Hallelujah Chorus”.

results.title: A Burlesque on Carmen
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Jesse Robbins and Essanay Film Manufacturing Company
results.brief_description: This film was intended by Chaplin to be a two-reel film, but to his annoyance additional material was added after he left Essanay, the Production Company of the film. It is a parody of two contemporary films based on Bizet’s opera, by Cecil B. De Mille (starring Geraldine Ferrar) and Raoul Walsh (starring vamp Theda Bara). Chaplin plays Darn Hosiery (Don Jose), the Corporal of the Guard who is seduced by Carmen (Edna Purviance) so that gypsy smugglers can get their swag through the city gates. His chief rivals for Carmen’s affections are Escamillo, the toreador and a fellow soldier of the guard, Leo White.

results.title: A Choice of two
results.creator_credit: John Howe and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: White-collar crime and corporate in-fighting merge as a chairman of the board must choose his successor from between two competent executives. All eyes are on the contenders when it is discovered that a defrauding of Farabee Industries is being orchestrated by someone within the arena of power. This drama was based on an actual case history and looks at an aspect of business ethics. Stars Leslie Nielsen. (Awards: Toronto)

results.title: A century of responsible government [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Dixon, Cine Service and Government of Victoria
results.brief_description: On 21st November, 1956, Victoria celebrated the centenary of responsible government in that State. To mark the occasion, the fortieth session of Parliament was formally opened by Sir Dallas Brookes, Governor of Victoria. At the ceremony Sir Dallas read a congratulatory message from the Queen and part of the speech made by Lieutenant McArthur when he opened the first Victorian Parliament in 1856. Also available on VHS [001846].

results.title: A Century of fantastic cinema: an interactive history of science fiction and horror films (PC)
results.brief_description: Join Eddie Munster (Butch Patrick) as he leads you on a fascinating tour of horror and science fiction films, starting from the early silent days and leading into the 1980’s. You can look through the poster gallery and see some great pictures and eerie sound and voice tracks; check out celebrity profiles; see what’s on at the theatre and peruse the souvenirs, all from the comfort of your own home.

results.title: A Cat's world
results.creator_credit: Robert Khodadad and Wall to Wall Television
results.brief_description: A Cat’s World is a fascinating foray into feline behaviour, examining how cats both perceive and react to the world around them by observing these mysterious creatures in domestic situations and in the wild beyond the home. Through the use of innovative camera techniques, the viewer can discover how cat senses function, and learn more about cat behaviour through the interpretation of visual cues.

results.title: A Calcutta Christmas
results.creator_credit: Maree Delofski, Denise Haslem, Film Australia and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Tucked away in the middle of the noisy polluted ‘city of joy’, Calcutta, is Tollygunge Home - a haven of peace and quiet for 35 elderly Christian Anglo-Indian residents. During the British colonial rule, British men were encouraged to marry Indian women in order that their children would help further Britain’s imperial interest in India. Children of these marriages became known as Anglo-Indians (or in earlier years, Eurasians) and lived a fairly wealthy lifestyle during the British colonial years of the late 19th century. However as time went on, racism and discrimination began to seep in and Anglo-Indians then found themselves in limbo - neither Indian nor British. After India won independence in 1947, two-thirds of the Anglo-Indian community emigrated to other parts of the British Commonwealth such as Britain, Canada and Australia. Those left behind became dislocated from their families and their living conditions declined quite dramatically. Tollygunge Home is financed by the East India Charitable Fund and managed by a committee of volunteers for these Anglo-Indian residents and this documentary explores their thoughts, memories and lifestyle through interviews. Shows them preparing for Christmas day celebrations in the traditional British way and highlights the personal interactions which take place, not only the anger, jealousies and loneliness but also the friendships, the bonding and love which holds them together as a community. Narrated by Rachel Blake.
